H0.text: All children except one grow up.. **Wendy Darling**

H1.text: All children except one grow up.. **The Little Prince**

H2.text: All children except one grow up.. **Alice in Wonderland**

H3.text: All children except one grow up.. Peter pan

A4.text: The opening line of the novel, 'All children, except one, grow up', and the conclusion of the story indicates that this wish is unrealistic, and there is an element of tragedy in the alternative.

A5.text: The play's subtitle 'The Boy Who Wouldn't Grow Up' underscores the primary theme: the conflict between the innocence of childhood and the social responsibility of adulthood. Peter has chosen not to make the transition from one to the other, and encourages the other children to do the same.
